comments.text: 2-4 hitchs to budweise, short waiting times. i prefer this way over the way over tabor

A great spot for hitchhiking cars to Germany
The gas station in the direction of Nürnberg is under construction right now, so the cars can't stop here (May 2018)
Caught a direct ride for three to Nürnberg here on a late Sunday morning in July. Seems like a brilliant spot on weekdays for said direction.
Quiet big gas station. We were here on sunday evening. Full of trucks. After two and half hours caught truck to Norinberg.

very good point and is to be reached by walking through the country along the motorway, NOT ON THE MOTORWAY
from metro terminus Ziclin you walk crosscountry
maybe the bus as mentioned above
I got a ride here twice to border or into germany
best spot to Praha, long bus stop, good and slow traffic, avg waiting time 10-20 min
Good place to travel to Prague. Cars go slow, there is a long bus lane and you are visible.
Best spot for going up north, extremely easy to get a ride for Prague. I use it many times a year and never wait for much more than five minutes. Take sign!
For me best spots for hitchhiking to Prague. I hitchike here a few times a year and average I wait here for 10 - 15 min.

Terminal station of trolley-bus 11. Or you can take free Tesco bus and walk back here.
You'll get car to Prague in a few minutes. This place is much better than place behind the mall. Cars are still slow here.
Great place to catch cars and easy to reach there by public transport. There is a lot of trucks having break and also big trafic of normal cars.
it took me longer to get there than to get a ride directly to Brno:D
Perfect place to go to Brno, did it in 12/2012 and found a lift quite fast
every time I go to Brno, I'm walking on the highway 3 km as the idiot (from opatov). perhaps a hundred times I went this route. thanks so much for this info. otherwise it is a great place to HH!

This petrol station is good for hitchhiking east towards Brno and Bratislava. From metro station Opatov (red C line) take bus 324, 363 or 385 to stop K Sukovu. You'll know you're there because 150m away to your right is the service station. Keep walking along the bus route, go over the bridge and walk onto the service station. Large, with many facilities and many opportunities to ask drivers. For more info, see http://www.hitchwiki.org/Prague
Good spot, I got a ride to Prague almost immediately.
medium traffic, we got a ride after 1 hour directly to Prague! :)
monday afternoon, ride to slovakia, this time not so many cars, mostly of them had there break there with eating etc.

To Brno, Praha. Gas station and parking with many cars and trucks. Ask truck drivers or cars at the gas station. I was lucky and found a direct ride to Dresden at the gas station after a rainy night in my tent a little bit up behind the restaurant (next to the street leading to the bridge). Police saw me, but didn't seem to bother that I camp there.
very good spot. I was there for multiple times.
A grandma with her two grandchildren took me close to Vysoké Mýto. Good spot.
Towards Hradec Králové. You can stay on bus station. It is located still in the town therefore the cars are driving quite slow

A really good place to hitchhike to Brno. 
3 cars stopped in the first 10 minutes
Didnt even need to wait, got a ride in like 10 seconds. great for traveling to brno
Nice spot to catch towards Brno and Břeclav
Great ride to the direction of Brno
We were very lucky and the first driver we approached agreed to get us a ride to Prague. The place is very busy and I believe you will definitely find someone going to Prague who will take you.

Perfect spot in my life
maximum 5 min to Prague
Easy to Prague!

fairly big petrol station with Mc'Donald therefore also quite busy..really good spot for longer rides (if i was alone i would get a ride to Copenahgen:D) ...but Prague, if you're lucky maybe even Germany could be possible!
Before opening of D3 highway probably a perfect spot for Prague but now its better to go to any village away from the city and than try PHA sign.
trolley bus last stop. very good spot with space to stop and slightly steepy so cars dont go very fast
We actually haven't even taken out our sign before a car stop by to ask if we need a ride. Just a really lucky ride directly to Praha I'd say.
Trolley bus no.2 or bus no.8 go there. Then on other side is place before parking.
Lot of traffic even at night :)
we got a ride from here directly to Bremen (!!!) at 10:30 p.m. (!!!)
Gas station + High tarfic of long routers.
prága és drezda közötti benzinkút. a  cseh oldalon az első/utolsó a határ után/előtt.
Good spot towards Harachov, all of the people driving here go there, and there is a place to stop.
Not bad spot towards Harrachov.

bus stop
->Brno

Good spot, cars see you from afar and there is long bus stop, and cars drive slow cuz there is a traffic lights 

Lift to Brno

Good for direction Brno. There is long bus stop, good for cars to stop you. And if you have bright clothes, cars can see you from far. 
I was extremely lucky and catch guy directly to Austria.

That is great spot, clearly the best in Znojmo. You have really good visibility and there is a lot of space for the drivers to stop. They are not going super fast, just leaving the city, so that's perfect.
Literally first thumb up and we were gone!
Nice place if you want go to Wien, we catch beautifull car with guy from Wien.. There is also small place, its safe for you and for your catch car :)
Waited only 5 minutes to Prague, good spot.
This place is good, I've hitchhiked here with my male friend and it took 2 hours to get a lift, but we got a lift to Prague.
good place to hitch hike, I hitch hiked from this spot every week for more than 2 years.
Shelter under the bridge. A lot of cars. Plenty of room to stop.
Shelter under the bridge. Lots of cars and lots of parking space.
Shelter under the bridge. Lots of cars and lots of parking space.
Good spot, it's possible to get there by public transport from Prague
Travelling as a group of 3, van took us directly to Brno, perfect start of a spontaneous trip :D
Very good place but hard to get too.

two guys waiting for ride to Brno.
I belive the best spot in west direction from Zlín
Generous women stopped after a while. We went to Brno

two guys waiting here over 90 mins on Monday about 13:30. we had a sign Brno, and in the end a friend stopped and took us to Brno. it should be a great spot, but somehow its not. Maybe inssead of the last bus station, it would be better to stand at the ramp. please comment your experience!
Very good spot in direction Prachatice
direction Ražice, in front of the train station

Best place if you wanna go to Poland, Harrachov, Tanvald,... :)
We cought the First car.
There is a bus station, just behind a roundabout, so cars are not going too fast. Good spot.

The best possibility for HH to Hraec Králové, Praha.. waiting <30min. Just stay on the road, put the thumb up and you will be faster than with a bus ticket. If you dont know the city, ask for cemetery (its about 50metres from that spot)

I been hitchhiking there with my friends to Prague. We split into two groups and the first group got ride in couple of minutes. My and my hitchhike colleague got stucked there and it was already getting dark so we decided to go further on a gas station to ask people. We asked about 8 people and got ride to Prague with a very nice guy.
If heading to PRG, all of spots here are good option, anyway U can always move up
We've been standing here not more than 30 minutes on a holiday. A good spot as it goes directly to Prague. Student Agency buses are going through this place.
Good place. Avoid going into Prague, it's far better to wait longer here than try to escape from the city for the price of being closer to a needed road.
Waited here one hour in the early night, then get a lift directly to Olomouc. Even in the evening there is fair traffic, because of McDonald's
Big petrol station before Prague. Chance to get a lift to the east - Brno, Olomouc, Vienna, ...
I regularly hitchhike from here towards the north and usually wait only a few minutes. There is good lighting, so you can hitchhike during night (I did it a couple of times and it was fast). :)

Two people, from Prague to Krkonoše;
We took a train to Horní Počernice, from where we went to a gas station. We waited at the exit, and after a few minutes, off-duty firefighters took us to Krkonoše.
Great spot to go to the South - very close to the highway towards Brno, visible and easy to stop.
I stood here multiple times. 100% the best spot towards Chomutov, usually takes less than 10 minutes.

Absolutely the best spot towards Prague. Slow cars, good spot to stop, could be seen easily by drivers. Hitched from here a lot of times times and never waited here for more than 10 minutes. Only problem is getting here, but if you can convince your driver to drop you off here, you are guaranteed to get nice ride.
Good spot towards Bečov nad Teplou and Pilsen.
Great place for Pilsen. Take bus no.6 to terminal station Doubí. It's not hard to find it from there ;)
After just a few minutes, a truck driver stopped and took us to Břeclav.
First car I saw stopped and took me to Hodonín. Good spot for going to the south.
Really nice spot, enough place to park a car
a very good place to get to České Budějovice, lots of space to stop and plenty of time to be seen by incoming cars. Almost every car is going to České Budějovice
Great if you want to get to Svitavy and from there to Brno

A really good spot with a lot of traffic to catch a ride to Svitavy or even Brno.
Caught a guy in like 4 minutes.
There is a lit of space on the side of the road for cars to stop.
There also is a supermarket nearby with a bike station.
A good place for us. We took a ride to Brno. The cars drive slowly and have plenty of space to stop. Recommended by other hitchhiker.
Best spot to Prague.
There is bus stop where cars can stop and many cars going from here to Hradec Králové or Pardubice, it is good spot.
As Nechutnas wrote, good spot to get anywhere north, no sign needed-save it for some intersection. Good luck!
Bus stop in direction to Kralovice and Most.
Good spot for HK. Position yourself that car's can see you good and also have enough time to pull over in the side-way. Sign optional

There are surprisingly not that many cars passing by but they're going slow and there is a nice place for them to stop. Also you can stand on the pavement and it's close to the main train station so that is nice
Before opening of D3 highway probably a perfect spot for Prague but now its better to go to any village away from the city and than try PHA sign.
Ending station of trolleybus. There is place for stopping car. And I was waiting 5 minutes for car Prague.
Just asked and I got straight lift to Brno (car with Czech registration plate with letter B on the second place)
After 5 minutes we get straight to Poland :)
I was going to Prague, and first man, which I asked , took me near airport.
This a great spot to Hradec Kralove  direction. Speed limit 50 km/h and enough space where drivers can stop to you. Favorite place for local hitchhikers.
This a great spot to Horice / Jicin  direction. Speed limit 50 km/h and enough space where drivers can stop to you. Favorite place for local hitchhikers.
Perfect spot, drivers riding slowly .)
Good spot for hitchhiking toward Rychnov nad Kněžnou.

Just before the rails there is some place by the road for cars to stop. The drivers slow down before the rails and hitch-hikers are visible. Good way to Poland (PL or Wrocław sign). Czech people living close to border use this road to come back from work/shopping.
The place is close to a traffic light. Drivers in cars may see you very well. There is a bus stop where cars can easily stop.
Since the new road has been built probably the best spot for hitchhiking towards Pardubice.
Not everybody going that direction, but if somebody will want to stop, he could stop easyly.
Perfect place for hh to Pisek (CB etc) and very easy to access it: only two stations by train from main railway station (15.04.16 the ticket price was 22 czk) and 500 m to walk.
Great place for hitchhiking to Kolín.
There is a bus stop. Cars drive really slow after the roundabout. Good place for Ostrava direction.
Good spot in direction to Jičín or Hradec Králové. There is a lot of place for cars to stop.
a great spot for hitchhiking to Žďár nad Sázavou or Havlíčkův Brod

Right after the bridge, turn to the right and you will see the spot just after the junction. Good if you are heading to Poland. There is Enough space for cars to stop and good visibility. Plenty of polish truck drivers who will be happy to take you with them! Waited 10 min.
Once I got from here to Mlada Boleslav in 1h, once to Tanvald after 10 minutes. Once I was here with my male friend and we stood here several hours, after that we took bus to Jablonec.

The best place to hitchhike in Harrachov in direction of Jablonec, Liberec, Praha. Just after the bridge, there is plenty of space to pull over and cars are not going really fast. You are visible from a very, very long distance. Traffic isn't so big, but you will finally find someone.
Stand right at the highway sign. I got a ride to Brno after 5 minutes.

There is a bus stop which is a great spot if you go to Brno or Praha. If a driver goes only to Brno and you want to continue to Praha (or just not to go to Brno and continue on D1), it is the best place to be dropped as there no petrol stations or good spots on D1 before a turning to the city. The waiting depends on day, but it generally pretty good. You usually get a lift pretty fast (in few minutes) on Sunday afternoon as many people are going back to Praha or Brno.

This spot should work also

If you hitch-hike in the direction to Uherské Hradiště or Brno, it is a great spot for you. There is a turning lane from the Benzina petrol station, where you can stand with your sign heading on passing cars. Many people go to Brno from this road, so you should not wait too long. Cars are driving quite fast here, but somebody always stops.
In front of the gas station. Traffic going still quite slow, a lot of cars in south direction (Uherské Hradiště and further). Hard shoulder for safe stop.
towards Zlín/Otrokovice. Hard shoulder with enough place to stop. In case of rain you can stay under the bridge. Traffic is going slow.
To Poland. Someone took me here from Praha. The first truck I asked took me to Wrocław
Cafe Solar near square > WiFi for beer here. Nice park here. Both 10 min from spot.
Is very easy to get from there to Plzeň (sulkov If U want to PRG)
First night covered by dark I was unlucky, w8ing here about 1 hour. Nex morning 20min to PGR

One of a best spot here, capable of use from both sides, it's in intravilan/vehicles must go to lower speed and also there's BUS stops so U can get here from/to city. Green square beside, its good for deploy a tent, I slept here for one night.
Very good place, waited less than 5 min

Good place for cars to stop. They all go slow in one lane and pretty much everyone who goes to Germany needs to go through here. A good place to choose drivers who go far to Germany and in your direction.
Bus stop at the end of Svitavy, perfect for travelling to Polička.
This may be a good place to Liberec. People from coming from centre turn left here onto the new motorway. The red light is long so you can ask people directly into the window. :)
Good spot when going to Zlin, Vsetin and Ostrava as well. There's a lane where cars can stop. I was there waiting less than 5 min and got a ride close to Zlin.
Great to Frýdlant nad Ostravicí
Towards Dvůr Králové and Trutnov. Bus station still officially located in the city therefore the cars are not driving that fast
There is bus station and a lot of traffic. Very good place in direction to Vizovice, Vsetín, Valašské Meziříčí.
Very good place for direction "Most".
Great spot, there is a large place for driver to stop and you can easily take a ride to Frýdek Místek and even to Český Těšín or Třinec
Direction motorway.
I tried many places in this road, but the best was some with railroad crossover. Cars are slowly even that the crossover is not working now. I waited in this place for 5 mins.
great place for hitchhiking I use it regulary
waiting 1 minute to Prague. Perfect stop in the village with good parking.
In Stará Huť on bus station "Knínska" is very good HH place to Dobříš or Prague. I waited here for 1 minute to Prague
crossroads
Road to Linz above the square. Many Austrians come to shop so it can be a good alternative to get to Austria.
kolikrát jsem se odsud dostal tam, kam potřebuju? řádově stovky aut. nedávno 8 minut čekání na spoj do Blavy přes Trenčín. Po cestě lom Rasová a Zelená voda v Novom Meste nad Váhom.
z míkovic či vések do světa (praha 3hod; brno 1hod; u.brod 25min; trenčín 2hod;...) velmi frekventovaná silnice, na obou stranách perfektní fleky na stop.
A lot of space to stop. Mostly all cars are going to Prague. Traffic speed is quite high, so just write a big "P".

Very good and safety spot for HH towards Pribram and Prague.
We were waiting there in 3 people for 5 minutes!
Spot is also good for Česke Budejovice direction.

There is a great hitch spot right on a bus stop to go northbound to Budweis or southbound to Linz, Austria. Personally, I´ve hitchhiked there for three times and got a lift in less than 10 minutes each time!

Up the hill near the bus station.
The cars are going slow (in the town), one is visible from a long distance because of a long turn up the hill and the drivers can stop at the bus station (not very frequented).
Good spot for getting a ride to the south - Jaroměř, Hradec Králové, even Prague if you're lucky.
Cars can see you from a large distance here on their way to Prague.
A good place towards the South at the petrol station exit. There is a place for cars to pull over.
Great place. When someone drops you on the exit to Příbram, go then to Dubenec and hitchhike there on the hard shoulder.
A good spot towards Prague.

From a city center, take the bus going to Olympia (it's free), from the shopping center continue trought the road going near and after the village Vsisko go under the bridge and start to hitchhike. Good opinion if you are going to south (Přerov, Zlín, ...)
2 petrolstations (on both sides)

Just after the roundabout there is a bus stop. Stand there with you sign, smile, and you will get a ride in no time. From the center of Krumlov there is a combination of cement paths and trails through the woods to get to this spot. Use this spot to hitch northbound, or to Ceske Budejovice where you have a better chance of getting a ride to further south to Linz. I got a ride in less than one minute.
to the "Otrokovice" or "Zlin". Cars don't drive very fast and they can see you from big distance.
Sunday, 12:01 PM. I stand here for 10 minutes till first car stop.

directions: Uherské Hradiště, Trenčín, Ukraina !!!, ...
from brno take a train ("Sp" to Slakov u Brna - it is the first station, so you cann drive black); than go right on the road cca 300m (under the bridge);
don't take this way if you want to budweis!! we waited two hours until a guy took us about 50km

Great place if you want to go to Strakonice or Pisek. From subway station Smichovske nadrazi take the bus nr. 129,172, 241, 243 to the second station called Mala chuchle. You need to press the button in the bus if you want to get out there. Then go aproximately 100 meters toward gas station. There is a long lane going out of it. There is a bridge so rain is not a problem.
This is a really great place to hitchhike! Either you want to get to Germany or to the Western Bohemia!

direction: M.Boleslav
take a bus (sory i dont remember the nuber...it was going from metro Černý Most) and go cca 1km here. on the leftside is a petrol station (We were a group of six people...4 were on the petrol station and 2 here)

it's possible to go further down as well so you can catch cars going from Olomouc as well. good spot direction Zábřeh..(if you were droped off at the petrol station from direction Hradec Králové - cross the bridge and turn left) ..good luck:)

Very favourite place for hitchhiking to Brno or Prostejov direction by many hitchhikers. Parking place near pub suitable during severe weather and tiny hostel. You can ask drivers at parking too. Easy to stop for trucks, dense traffic. Waiting for a lift was never longer than half an hour.

Pleasant place after main crossing near bus stop, train station and supermarket. Direction to south - Uherske Hradiste, Breclav, Austria... Heavy traffic, and enough place to stop for drivers. Waiting was never longer than hour.
small gas station, you can get there by some bus that goes to Globus (thats the name of the stop). in direction to the west from Ãšsti, to Karlovy Vary for example

Very good place, direction to Svitavy, Hradec Kralove or Pardubice and Sumperk and Jesenik too. Wide road and enough place to stop for drivers. Sometimes there can be parking cars near this place. Small pub across the road on the north.

Good place near bus station, direction Svitavy, Hradec Kralove, Pardubice, Sumperk or Jesenik. Dense traffic and 50km/h speed limit - waiting was never longer than 1 hour. Some pubs and shops in village around.
On the bridge by gas station. The Best Place for hitch direction to Prague or SE to Hradec.
It's on the left side of the road but it is really nice and speed spot to stop somebody towards Prague.
There is a bus stop, where you can stand when you are heading to Prague or Pisek. It`s just behind gas station.

Really nice spot for Znojmo and Vienna, cars are slow from the roundabout, can see you clearly and almost everybody goes in this direction. Even though it didn't feel really safe a truck stopped for me after just few minutes. But for a passenger car, the spot is large enough.

I have been there for multiple times. It right after main parkinglot. Lot of Polish people going home. Probably best spot, if you wanna get from Adršpach. You can go by train if you would not be lucky. You can see it comming.
Not a bad spot towards the Desná and Harachov border crossing. Cars don't go that slowly, but they can see you, and there is a place to stop.
I needed to get out of Liberec in the direction of Jablonec / Poland. I asked around here, and one guy brought me to a much better spot near Jablonec.
Maybe I got lucky, but I got a ride all the way to Liberec. To me, this is a good spot for Liberec direction.
Nice one, I hitched from here multiple times and never waited for long. Sing advised or just go by thumb to Klášterec (next town), and there are cars going slower.
I went to festival, so people, who went there too, picked me up.
One guy asked me if I want a ride.

Local hitchhiking
Lot of space next to the road
First car stoped for me
Very comfortable spot because of shadow from trees. local hitchhiking
Best spot from Hradec Králové to Nové Město nad Metují. I was there for multiple times.

lot of cars
it was quick

I was there for multiple times
<3 my first spot

I know this place and I knew iw would be a good spot.
It's a place with big traffic, but it's local traffic. I didn't even get to Liberec as I wanted.
každý den jezdím tuto cestu
Most people from here are going to Liberec, but with a bit of luck they also head towards Prague. You might also find someone going towards Železný Brod. A sign is useful here.
Good spot for Nymburk, Mladá Boleslav and further north.
After a few moments, a local worker took me to Šumperk.
There is a huge space for cars to stop, and the traffic is pretty dense. A guy took me (single male) to Prague after 25 minutes
Enough space to stop, many cars
Many cars, but no one wanted to stop
Easy visible, enough space to stop

I actually had little hope for this place, because the fuel station looks very old and gets little traffic, but if you stay BEFORE it and hold the sign/thumb as much visible as possible, your ride will stop and get you to Austria.
Would recommend, but it is firther than a shopping mall 3.6km before (to the north)

To be honest, not the greatest spot, but the best, when it comes to car going from Prague to Slaný and you need to get to Chomutov. Ask around, you only need ride to Lotouš and from there it's easy. (Look up Lotouš place I created) Not a lot of cars stopping here, but you don't need long ride.

Lotouš is the best place to get off when going to Chomutov, but the car goes only to Louny. Hitched from here multiple times and always worked becouse of the 50km/h speed limit. Sign adviced. There is a bus stop, where the cars can easily stop.
low traffic, but we catched car very quickly

Extremely good spot in Prague direction, almost all of the cars go that way and I would even alvise not to take any half way, but all the way to Prague, if it's your destination. Not so good going to Chomutov direction though.
Great place to hitch hike in direction of Liberec

Great place. The drivers can see you from great distance and they can decide whether to stop. They have to slow down because of the crosswalk. There is a bus station where they can stop. I recommend it.

Not really a safe spot,but people can see you here and go quite slow, only disadvantage is that there is no good place to pull over, but always somebody stops for me.
Sign adviced, people are much more likely to stop, becouse traffic splits just after you.
Really nice spot, almost everybody goes in Most direction, sign adviced, can be easily obtained from nearby supermarkets.
The best spot on the planet. Hitchhiked here every day from school in Karlovy Vary direction (but shorter distance). Never waited more than 10 minutes. Absolutely love it 10/10

We got a ride to Svitavy (35 km) within quarter an hour. The spot is great, because cars are able to see you from a far distance. There is a  lay-by where even trucks can stop, so it is very chill to get in and out of vehicles :)
Amazing spot, good asking people around, all go to CZ
A lot of people are sayin its not good for hitching with a sign, maybe i was just lucky. But there was place to stop. Had a sign A6 - west and a couple in a van stopped and took me near Frankfurt.

Nice spot on the old bus stop. It is worth to go there and catching than in center of Zlote Hory. Some czech guy took us to Vbrno pod Pradadem from there but before that three more people had stopped next to us and asked about our destination.

At petrol station. 
A truck driver couldn't give us a ride, but instead gave us sweets and an orange.
After that, we got a lift to final destination.
Good spot to Pilsen.
First car took us, perfect if you are going to or just through Plzeň
Not many cars, but enough place to park car
Perfect spot, good traffic, right way on the highway
Nice spot for going to Česká Lípa, enough place to stop a car on the bus station
Very good spot, there is a room to pull over. We had a sign with Prague and waited only about 5-10 min.
Perfect spot for going back from Okurky
Nice spot at a low-speed street, countryside with lower transport and shorter travel distances but willing people
Traffic passing very slowely and enough place to pull over. Gas station nearby if you want to try your luck there
Very good spot, there is a lot of space for cars and drivers see you from quite a long distance. Got a ride to Olomouc
Small pickup with sign BRNO, next station Viena.
Really good spot
I wanted to go to Prague amd this sweet man stops and give mi cigaret and nice conversation
I was there like 20 min and two cars stops, one wasnt right ald the second one drives to Veselí so I got in. I tried some other spots but i think this is best spot to go to Prague form Budweis
Nice spot towards Svitavy and Brno
People are not going far, but from a bus stop to another, it goes
I got a ride to Vienna - very good spot. Cars drive only 50km/h and there is space to stop for them
Best spot direction on Prague

we were very lucky, because when we were unloading the stuff from the previous car, people saw the sign I was holding and just honked and stopped right next to it, the sign said Linz, Graz and it ended right in Graz
people drive slow, big space to stop on the busstop, they see you really good, 2 males,
Waited on a busy day where traffic was very slow, got offered a ride 3 times in this 2 minutes. Got a ride straight to our destination to Olomouc

Very good spot to catch someone going to Prague. It’s the last station in Karlovy Vary. There’s a shop nearby so a lot of people are local, doing their shopping. Some lauries stopping as well.  To get here you take a bus number 3 androgenów for 13 minutes. You can buy tickets inside of the bus. Then you see this station after arriving to this stop (also last stop on this line). In the end I highly recommend this spot.
Held a sign saying Decin, which is where most traffic will be going with the final destination being Dresden
After 5 minuts I found transport to Ostrava (centrum)
Very wide turn, comfortable for cars to stop, around here the settlements get smaller and less traffic, but good chance of a car going at least towards Moravsky Beroun, wait time of 5 minutes
best from czech to passau
best place to prague
There's officially forbidden to stop but I tried it anyways since it is a very convenient spot direction Brno. I had a sign saying Brno. Very good spot, all traffic goes there 💪🏼
After five minutes one young lady took me to Brno.

There is a nice place where the cars can stop, I was standing under the tree just before turn to the left. I was waiting for a while, but a lot of cars are going into this direction, so was not difficult.

Good spot to go North. Bus stop after lights so cars drive slowly. We used a sign Rumburk, got a lift in 3 minutes, friendly driver took us even a little further to Germany (we headed to Berlin). Probably could work even in the south direction on the opposite bus stop (to Prague or Mlada Boleslav). Heads up, hitchhikers!

Saturday morning, 9 o clock.

Excellent place!
Lots of cars coming through, all exiting through one lane, thumbing near the exit got me a few drivers asking where i was going, and i got a direct ride to Ostrava in 20 mins.

After approximately an hour we got picked up by some guys who were actually going in a different direction - but they had the time to help us getting to the right road :)

good place for Praha, the access is not that hard, over narrow stream, through the hole in a fence under train station, than go to the right end of the wall and there is no fence and not so steep climb, we got a ride to Praha in 30 minutes with very nice romaian truck driver
brilliant. read the comments that it's hard to get here. I came by car so I had no issues at all. Would recommend.

Get the train to Brno - Starý Lískovec, from there you must walk to Martina Ševčíka street and just before you cross under highway you need to climb up next to highway on the side of the gas station. waited for an hour with a sign at the end of the station. Then a trucker took me to near Amberg. Pretty okay spot, took longer than expected.

Many cars going to direction east. Got picked up by a friendly woman, taking us to the next gas station.

Jinak řečeno, málo aut a většina místních, ale lepší než drátem do oka.

Place is lost - Highway is finnished here...

Many times leaving Prague sunday early afternoon I hoped to be home (Gliwice in PL) before midnight. 95% succeded
I dislike standing at Cerny Most among other hitchers thefore I walk to the first gas station. There  I ask to the Hradec K. and get off at the place I indicate  here. It's a marvelous one.
ALL  the traffic from the highway stops here. 
A perfect spot either to ask or show your destination board to the driver. :)
I Never waited more than 15 min in here and mostly got a direct ride to
a good spot for hitchhiking to Žďár nad Sázavou or Havlíčkův Brod, cars come slowly because of the railway crossing and the intersection but there is not much space for a car to stop

I wanted to go Bratislava but the vast majority of the cars were going to Viena, so not so many options. Although this lack of cars we only had to wait for 30 minutes. But i recommend to wait on a gas station on the highway than here

Direction Ústí n. L., Dresden, Berlin.
Safe place to HH (lots of space to stop), but not too many cars are driving by. You can get here with bus 103, stop is Skládka Ďáblice.
We were standing next to the merging lane and fortunately quickly got a ride towards Plzen. However I don't recommend that place because of the police regularly controlling the highway.

A decent spot if you get dropped on the way to/from HK and wanna get to Chrudim. The traffic is kinda light, the curve you're standing in can get almost blind in the summer from one direction (high corn field) and there's not much space for the cars to stop. Still hitchable though.

A spot on the motorway, near the emergency exit (easy to get there or out across the field). Cars drive really fast but there's long and wide breakdown lane for them to stop, dont forget to check every once in awhile behind you ;)
Fairly enough place for cars to stop, good visibility, local traffic.
Petrol station, direction ČB. Mostly local traffic.
Old way to Prague, got a lift after into Prague in 20 minutes
Bus station for safe stop. Traffic in the south direction. Waited here in two people some two hours to get a lift to Strážnice.
Great spot in direction to Hulín

Average-good place near D1 highway, useful for hitchhiking to Brno or Prague. High traffic density at working days. Better to use sign like 'D1-Brno' or 'D1-Praha(Prague)'. Gas station and supermarket on the south.
Got pick up by driver from car service, he was on way to PRG directly, without any card-sign. It was about 6 p.m.

Good spot there, moderate traffic toward Nové Strašecí (on way to PRG) and someone also goes to PRG directly. Up by the way is one more line for trucks (because its up to hill) and its long, so car can safely pick up you. Trees are near road so if sun is high on sky you will be still cool with that. Also if no one can pick you, get rest by just going down to town, straight by the street, there´s museum and park with small river and many benches.
I left here 8 hrs for w8ing to Plzeň. In this way seem to be senseless.

Good place for me if you want to Linz and Munich, cos truck drivers sleep here. But for stopping cars its very bad cos trucks occupied all right line so cars cannot make it to my side, better is try it btw 4-6 when traffic jam coming and the pick up someone for exit.
You can choose here 2 ways to Rakovnik (RK) 1.from here or 2. back across the bridge and then rail tracks and continue by Lánská with thumb up.

Seems to be really great place - there is a lot of space for cars to stop and there is a bus stop to stay when it´s raining for example. But for some reason we waited for about 40 minutes even though the traffic was quite high. To: Nový Bor.
Not the best spot.
Not the best option. Guys, who picked us up told us that we are standing in a shitty place and gave us a ride to another spot. It depends on how lucky you are.

OMV petrol station, enough traffic but mostly locals.

Direction Sokolov, Cheb. Not very nice place but possible to hitch.
Find Lidl next to McDonalds and you'll see it.
In direction Most/Chomutov - Have a cardboard. You can meet here a local hitchhikers who's going to next village called Třemošná. Lot of local traffic but there is lot of space to stop.
useless spot for hitchhiking
Doesn't look very good to stop but it's ok.
Spot toward Boskovice on the bus stop. There is similar spot one hundred meters before, which can be maybe better, because the cars are not driving as fast as around this place
this way can be to Budweis as well.
Not a best place on the way to Prague since the cars cannot see very far.
Towards to Prague and Budweis.
Enough cars towards Prague or other directions, but everybody seems concentrated on understanding this weird crossroad.

From Usti do Dresden. From Usti to Dresden. It's on a slip-road, not much place to stop, only if the traffic isinfrequent ( which I'm believe it usually is - so no problem). I suggest to hitchhike first somewhere on Havířská street from Usti, and if somebody who doeasn't ride to the highway takes you, let him drop you off before the bridge over the highway - and this is your spot.
direction Písek
Good place to go to Slovakia but little traffic
End of highway. Legal spot for hh. A lot of cars. Place to stop, but most driving quite fast.
This is a good spot for Modřice and Brno. There is a place for cars to stop. But not such a busy road.
horribly far from the centre but probably the only decent hitching spot. stand on the bridge behind the rail and wave your sign for germany - a guy picked me up in about 25 mins

I have dropped off on that exit and then continued towards to Domazlice and Regensburg. I think it is a good stoplatz cause it´s set in front of the village so drivers dont go very fast so they can take a look at you.

You can ask trucker at this rest house.

all drivers want to Prague
Direction Praha, most traffic local

After a 4 min, Police came, and I asked them to gave me a lift until the first petrol station, which is at 20 km far away. And they was agree. i don't know if was because of my smile or just the cech police are nice.
Place on a bridge where cars goes slow and there is a space to stop. Small traffic but there is only way directed to Nový Jičín, Olomouc, Brno and Prague.
On the bus stop. Because it's still a urban area, cars are not speeding. Mostly local people, however we managed to catch a car to Wien.

Not a good either safe place to hitch hike. Try not to get there.
If someone will take you only to Starý Hrozenkov, be happy as well.  It is easy to hitchhike there to Brno direction. There is one more place in the center of the village.

Bus stop (line #22 from city centre, e.g. Fügnerova). I think that is the best spot towards Jablonec, Poland and east direction, generally. It's better to stand couple meters before bus stop - it will be easier for stop the car, in my opinion.
Not very high traffic. But I waited there about 15 minutes in Germany direction
A spot at the highway, cars are fast, but it took me less than 10 min to get a ride to Nuremberg, Germany

Direction Brno:
We hitchhiked from here trying to reach Bratislava. It a small gas station but with plenty of cars. Unfortunately mostly locals, and 90% is not speaking english. A lot of people looked also rude not even listening to what we were trying to say, or scared and just running away. Eventually we got a ride with a truck driver to Brno. It's not a good spot, but the best if you are planning to go south after dark
Spot is okay, drivers have enough time to read your sign. But the direction to Plzen is dead. We had to go to Prague after 2 hours of waiting.

Probably the main spot for the direction of Plzen in Milevsko. However, nobody gave us a ride even to Lety. Drivers from Milevsko are not interested, and others go too fast.

it is good spot to find a car towards Teplice

Not far away from train and bus station. Go in the direction to Vimperk. Just behind the supermarket is a crossroad and after it, there is a place where you can try your luck.

I the end i decided to take a bus to the city but i think if you wanna go to any main direction in czech you mght be able to find a lift here.

We were hitchhiking 2 boys 1 girl to budapest and we were really lucky because we actually stopped someone

absolute trash spot. no place to stop, very risky intersection, just avoid this place.
